required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Owlet Band Observational Study: Observe the Use of a New Pregnancy Tracker for Expecting Mothers
clinical_study.official_title: Owlet Band Observational Study: Observe the Use of a New Pregnancy Tracker for Expecting Mothers

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational research study of a new pregnancy tracker used to gather information about a pregnant woman's general wellness.

detailed_description.textblock: The Owlet Band is a wellness product (similar to a fitbit), it is not designed to be a "medical device". The study involves women age 18 and older who are currently pregnant, at least 24 weeks' gestation or later, and who live in the USA. Up to 8,000 pregnant women are expected to participate in the study. This study will involve review of Owlet Band data and participant responses to questionnaires throughout the study. The purpose of this research is to observe if using the new Owlet Band and the associated iPhone app can help pregnant women in managing their habits, anxiety, stress, enhancing bonding and attachment to their infant, while still maintaining their standard medical care.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of enrollment until the date of reported delivery or early termination , whichever came first, assessed up to 16 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Successful collection of Owlet Band data from study participants
Completion of study questionnaires by at least 500 participants

secondary_outcome.measure: Management of anxiety State Trait Anxiety Inventory
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participant completion of the STAI questionnaire before wearing the Owlet Band and at Day 31 (+3 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in anxiety as assessed by State Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participant completion of the PSS questionnaire before wearing the Owlet Band and at Day 31 and Day 52 (+3 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in perceived stress as assessed by Perceived Stress Scale (PSS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant's experience while using the Owlet Band
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 16 weeks
Through study completion, up to 16 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Self-Report of standard medical care and unexpected or unscheduled visits

intervention.description: The Owlet Band is a wearable fabric band pregnancy tracker made up of small sensors that are able to detect natural low-level electrical signals normally produced by the mother's heart and baby's (fetal) heart.

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women 24 weeks' gestation and later

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must be at least 24 weeks pregnant with a singleton pregnancy
- Must be at least 18 years of age
- Must currently live in the United States
- Must have a compatible smartphone (Apple iOS Version 13 or above)
- Able to read and understand English in order to provide Informed Consent and follow study instructions
Exclusion Criteria:
- NA
